title: Max Greger & His Orchestra: Greger's Groove Party (2008)
description:
German saxophonist and bandleader Max Greger formed one of the most popular of all dance bands in Europe in the 1950s, discovering a successful formula for mixing pop, jazz and swing tunes with a groove that made people want to move.

His bands always featured some of EuropeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s best and best-known stars from the jazz constellation. The music, while always catchy and easy to keep up with, maintained firm roots in the jazz tradition, a component that dates back to the American bands of Benny Goodman and GregerÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s hero, Glenn Miller.

Max Greger was always considered the funkier counterpart to GermanyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s other band leaders that included James Last, Bert Kaempfert, Horst Jankowski, Kurt Edelhagen and Roberto Delgado.

This collection gathers 18 evergreens Greger recorded with his Tanzorchester between 1965 and 1973. 

A great party.



Max Greger
